doc.field: Access to multi-disciplinary information on Africa including books, journal articles, maps and music recordings.
Provides abstracts of journals, reviews and dissertations on United States and Canadian history from prehistory to the present.
Includes digitized images of the pages of American magazines and journals published from colonial days to the dawn of the 20th century.
Wide-ranging collections of information for conducting genealogical and local history research.
Bibliographic records of journal articles, conference proceedings and collection articles on many subject areas relating to Classical Studies.
Annual Reviews volumes are published each year for 41 focused disciplines within the Biomedical, Life, Physical, and Social Sciences including Economics.
Provides full text articles from American Anthropological Association journals, newsletters, and bulletins. Covers 1888-present.
Abstracts of journals, museum bulletins and yearbooks in the fields of art, architecture, decorative arts and photography.
Digital library that provides access to thousands of digital images derived from a variety of museum, library and archival collections.
Online access to the entire core collection of more than fifty significant scholarly journals in the field of religion.
Provides citations to journals in the fields of architecture, city planning, interior design, historic preservation and archaeology. Covers 1930-present.
Journal articles, book chapters, conference proceedings, and other material on all subjects pertaining to East, Southeast, and South Asia.
Abstracts and citations to journal articles, books, conference proceedings, technical reports and patents, and other material in biomedicine, biotechnology, zoology, ecology, and related fields.
Full-text access to research journal articles in such fields as the biological, ecological, and environmental sciences.
Comprehensive online guide to book reviews with over five million review citations.
A biweekly, peer-reviewed scientific journal publishing research papers across a broad range of disciplines within the life sciences.
Weekly news and job-information source for college and university faculty members, administrators, and students.
Citations to Latin American and Caribbean journal articles, books, and other material in the social sciences, humanities, science and technology fields.
Searchable collection of journals, books, reference works, and conference materials in the brain and cognitive sciences.
Original reporting and analysis on issues in the news, focusing on the economy, education, the environment, health, international affairs, social trends, and technology.
More than 240 reference works in various fields.
Citations, abstracts, and previews of dissertations and theses submitted by Bryn Mawr College and published in UMI's Dissertation abstracts database.
A collection of dissertations and theses from around the world in the Humanities and Social Sciences.
Subject catalogs of publications on the history of art and the ancient world.
Ebook content across all subject areas.
Includes more than 30,000 current e-books from leading publishers in all subjects.
Abstracts to economic journals, books, book reviews, dissertations, and working papers.
Full-text access to English-language titles and editions published between 1701 and 1800.
Abstracts to journal articles and ERIC Digest records on all aspects of education.
An authoritative alternative to the IMDB.
Articles, film reviews and book reviews from film and television journals from 30 countries.
Full-text access to scholarly journals, magazines, newspapers, books, and other material focused on how gender affects a broad spectrum of subject areas.
Scholarly literature from all broad areas of research.
Records describing books, book chapters, articles, and conference papers published in the field of Latin American studies.
Citations to scholarly journal articles published in Latin America, Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean.
Electronic and print versions of senior theses from Haverford students.
Abstracts of journal articles, books, book reviews and dissertations that cover world history from 1450 to the present.
Search 151 journals, more than 900 conference proceedings, more than 3,400 technical standards, and more than 400 ebooks and 200 educational courses.
Citations to literature on Islam, the Middle East and Muslim areas of Asia and Africa, and Muslim minorities elsewhere.

The fully searchable electronic version provides access to nearly 2,000 articles on all aspects of dance, including theatrical, ritual, dance-drama, folk, traditional, ethnic, and social dance. Cultural and national overviews are accompanied by entries on dance forms, music and costumes, performances, and biographies of dancers and choreographers. Entries are also A-Z browsable.
Contains time series data for most IMF members (over 200 countries).
International Index to the Performing Arts
Abstracts and full-text journal articles covering a broad spectrum of the arts and entertainment industry.
international index to the performing arts
Abstracts and citations to articles on medieval subjects in journals, Festschriften, conference proceedings, and collected essays.
Articles from the top journals in most disciplines.
Thousands of newspapers, magazines, transcripts, & legal materials.
Weekly U.S. news magazine with an emphasis on photojournalism.
Biographies, bibliographies, and critical analyses of authors from every age and literary discipline.
Abstracts of the world's literature in linguistics and language-related research.
Citations to the world's mathematical literature including all aspects of mathematics, statistics, and related areas.
Citations to journal articles, books, conference proceedings, and other materials in the areas of literature, language, linguistics, film, theatre and folklore.
A NASA-funded project that provides abstracts and/or citations to journals in astronomy and astrophysics.
A weekly international, interdisciplinary peer-reviewed journal of science.
Online audio recordings of classical, folk, jazz, and world music from the Naxos, Marco Polo, and Da Capo labels.
New York Times on the Web
Full-text access to news articles, blog posts, videos, images, and multimedia features.
new york times on the web
Full-text access to English-language titles and editions published between 1801 and 1900.
Includes more than seventy seminal as well as lesser known contemporary indexes to English-language publishing prior to 1930.
Full-text articles on every aspect of the visual arts from prehistory through the present.
Complete text of the 20-volume OED, 2nd edition, published in 1989.
Covers all topics related to music, including musical instruments, compositional forms and scientific topics.
grove dictionary of music and musicians
new grove dictionary of music and musicians
Abstracts of journal articles, books, and other material about political, economic, social and public policy issues.
Index to journal articles in the arts, humanities, and social sciences.
Full-text online versions of back issues of selected French journals in the humanities and social sciences.
Citations and abstracts of journal articles, books, anthology contributions and book reviews published worldwide on philosophy and related topics.
Abstracts and full-text articles on public policy research and analysis from think tanks, university research programs, research organizations and publishers.
policy file: public policy research and analysis
Access to journals published by the Johns Hopkins University Press. Disciplines covered are humanities, social sciences, and mathematics.
Covers lower and higher education, special education, home schooling, adult education, and other related topics.
Citations and full-text articles in a variety of disciplines.
Full text access to articles from journals published by APA and allied organizations.
Abstracts of journals, books, book chapters, technical reports and dissertations in psychology and related disciplines.
Biomedical articles from MEDLINE and additional life science journals.
Provides indexing of general-interest periodicals published in the United States and reflects the history of 20th century America.
Reserves available at campus libraries, including books, videos, and sound recordings.
Covers material published in music and various other fields as they relate to music.
Scholarship, Research, and Creative Work at Bryn Mawr College
An open access repository of the scholarship and publications of the Bryn Mawr community.
Leading journal of original scientific research, news and commentary published by the American Association for the Advancement of Science.
Full-text,online access to journal articles in the life, physical, medical, technical, and social sciences.
Access to CAplus, a database of chemical literature and U.S. and foreign chemical-related patents, CASREACT, and the Registry database from Chemical Abstracts Service.
registry database for chemical abstracts service
Abstracts of journal articles and dissertations in social work and related areas.
Abstracts of journal articles, books, book chapters, dissertations and conference papers in the fields of sociology, social work and related disciplines in the social and behavioral sciences.
Weekly news magazine focused on international politics, business news, and opinion.
Weekly U.S. magazine devoted to politics and culture.
British daily national newspaper, first published in London in 1785.
Full-text database of primary sources covering Greek literature from Homer to the fall of Byzantium.
Tables of contents from a selection of Classics, Near Eastern Studies, and Religion journals.
tables of contents of journals of interest to classics
Art and artifacts from Bryn Mawr, Haverford, and Swarthmore Colleges.
Digital materials associated with the research and scholarship of Bryn Mawr, Haverford, and Swarthmore Colleges as well as materials of historical value to the Colleges.

Access to the digital collections of Bryn Mawr College Special Collections, Haverford College Special Collections, Swarthmore College Friends Historical Library and Swarthmore College Peace Collection.
Listen to the Tri-College online music collection.

Access to the Social Sciences Citation Index, Science Citation Index, and Arts and Humanities Citation Index. Search for scholarly articles in any discipline, or for articles that cite a known author or work. Go to the Web of Science tab for a cited reference search.
Citations and abstracts of journal articles, books, book chapters, newspapers, dissertations and bulletins, in the core areas of women's studies.
The primary World Bank collection of development indicators, compiled from officially-recognized international sources.
A catalog of the holdings of books, journals, and other materials held by libraries worldwide.
Citations and abstracts of journals in political science and related fields including international relations, law, and public administration/policy.
Semi-annual publication featuring articles on Quaker contributions to issues such as social justice, education and literature. Also includes book and article reviews.
The Database of Recorded American Music
A collection of sound recordings documenting American music not generally covered by commercial recording companies.

A database of music from around the world, including genres such as: reggae, worldbeat, neo-traditional, world fusion, Balkanic jazz, African film, Bollywood, Arab swing and jazz, Indian classical, fado, flamenco, klezmer, zydeco, gospel, gagaku and more.
Provides online audio recordings of American folk, blues, bluegrass, jazz, spoken word, and world music from the Smithsonian Folkways label and others.
